bibl.title: "As Is the Generations of Leaves" in Homer, Simonides, Horace, and Stobaeus.
bibl.note: An earlier version of this paper appeared in: Arethusa 29 (1996) pp. 263-282. - I.E.G. II2, Simonides, 19-20 and Homer, Il. VI, 145-149. - Pp. 286-288: Appendix. Passages by "Mousaios", Pindar, Bacchylides, Empedocles, Aristophanes, and Vergil (also alluding to Homer's simile).

bibl.title: The New Simonides. Contexts of Praise and Desire

bibl.seg: SIDER David, "As Is the Generations of Leaves" in Homer, Simonides, Horace, and Stobaeus.
Deborah BOEDEKER and David SIDER (Edd.), The New Simonides. Contexts of Praise and Desire (Oxford, 2001) pp. 272-288.

An earlier version of this paper appeared in: Arethusa 29 (1996) pp. 263-282. - I.E.G. II2, Simonides, 19-20 and Homer, Il. VI, 145-149. - Pp. 286-288: Appendix. Passages by "Mousaios", Pindar, Bacchylides, Empedocles, Aristophanes, and Vergil (also alluding to Homer's simile).
